newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK SHORT RATES TO FALL TO 10PCT BY END-96 - CITI.
newsitem.headline: GREEK SHORT RATES TO FALL TO 10PCT BY END-96 - CITI.

text.p: Greek short-term money rates could drop to around 10 percent by end-96 on a lower inflation outlook helped by the hard hard drachma policy, said Citibank, London in its September rolling forecast review.
The maintenance of the hard drachma policy will help CPI-based inflation drop to 7.0 percent or below by the turn of the year, it said.
The drachma is likely to appreciate by 6.0 percent in real terms in 1996 against the Ecu, implying the ecu/drachma will remain roughly unchanged in nominal terms.

Three-month drachma rates will be at 12.80 percent in a month from now, 11.50 percent in three-months, 10.50 percent in six-months and 11.50 percent in 12-months, it said. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
